Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2013 08:14AM Walkinginfaith wrote: It seems that when the drain is in for a while it gets sore at the drain site. I think the body starts healing around the drain and any movement becomes uncomfortable. When the drain is removed there is immediate relief.
Posts.Title: August 2013 Surgeries laura11103 babs6287

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2013 05:24PM Walkinginfaith wrote: Re fills: I was filled at time of surgery to 180cc. Three weeks postop 60cc more to take up space and manage seroma. Two weeks ago 90cc with my next appt for another fill in a week. For the 90cc fill I took a muscle relaxer before. During the fill very minor tightness at the end. My PS started at 60 and let me decide how much to go with the option of 120. I was very comfortable at 90 so stopped there. My BS said go smaller and more frequent with fills given the choice.
Posts.Title: August 2013 Surgeries laura11103 babs6287

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2013 06:30PM Walkinginfaith wrote: I did chemo first for 3 small masses that were 5cm total. I felt the mass decrease in size after the first treatment. By surgery day (I chose bilateral mastectomy) the mass was only 4mm and lymph nodes clean.

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2013 04:15PM Walkinginfaith wrote: I had it too. Your pecs attach there and the positioning/stretching during surgery cause it. That pain limited me more then any other area. It does go away. Good luck!
Posts.Title: Pain in sternum after mastectomy? celtictrek nwgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2013 11:50PM Walkinginfaith wrote: I started chemo TCH March 6, six cycles with weekly Herceptin. I had no bone pain after Neulasta. I used Claritin D one day before Neulasta and four days after. My MO ok'd it. Claritin D can affect blood pressure.
